metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
resource group name where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
subscription id where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

connectorUiConfig.title: Palo Alto Cortex XDR (Preview)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Palo Alto Cortex XDR](https://cortex-panw.stoplight.io/docs/cortex-xdr/branches/main/09agw06t5dpvw-cortex-xdr-rest-api) data connector allows ingesting logs from the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API into Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector is built on Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform. It uses the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API to fetch logs and it supports DCR-based [ingestion time transformations](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-overview) that parses the received security data into a custom table so that queries don't need to parse it again, thus resulting in better performance.

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Incidents_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Incidents_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Endpoints_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Endpoints_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Alerts_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Alerts_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Audit_Management_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Audit_Management_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Audit_Agent_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Audit_Agent_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

parameters.content:
#### Configuration steps for the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API 
 Follow the instructions to obtain the credentials. you can also follow this [guide](https://cortex-panw.stoplight.io/docs/cortex-xdr/branches/main/3u3j0e7hcx8t1-get-started-with-cortex-xdr-ap-is) to generate API key.

#### 1. Retrieve API URL
   1.1. Log in to the Palo Alto Cortex XDR [**Management Console**] with Admin user credentials
   1.2. In the [**Management Console**], click [**Settings**] -> [**Configurations**] 
   1.3. Under [**Integrations**] click on [**API Keys**].
   1.4. In the [**Settings**] Page click on [**Copy API URL**] in the top right corner.

#### 2. Retrieve API Token
   2.1. Log in to the Palo Alto Cortex XDR [**Management Console**] with Admin user credentials
 2.2. In the [**Management Console**], click [**Settings**] -> [**Configurations**] 
   2.3. Under [**Integrations**] click on [**API Keys**].
   2.4. In the [**Settings**] Page click on [**New Key**] in the top right corner.
   2.5. Choose security level, role, choose Standard and click on [**Generate**]
   2.6. Copy the API Token, once it generated the [**API Token ID**] can be found under the ID column

dataFlows.transformKql: source | project  TimeGenerated = now(), IncidentId=incident_id, IncidentName=incident_name, CreationTime=datetime(1970-01-01) + (creation_time * 1ms), ModificationTime=datetime(1970-01-01) + (modification_time * 1ms), DetectionTime=datetime(1970-01-01) + (detection_time * 1ms), Status=status, Severity=severity, Description=description, AssignedUserMail=assigned_user_mail, assignedUserPrettyName=assigned_user_pretty_name, AlertCount=alert_count, LowSeverityAlertCount=low_severity_alert_count, MedSeverityAlertCount=med_severity_alert_count, HighSeverityAlertCount=high_severity_alert_count, CriticalSeverityAlertCount=critical_severity_alert_count, UserCount=user_count, HostCount=host_count, Notes=notes, ResolveComment=resolve_comment, ResolvedTimestamp=datetime(1970-01-01) + (resolved_timestamp * 1ms), ManualSeverity=manual_severity, ManualDescription=manual_description, XdrUrl=xdr_url, Starred=starred, Hosts=todynamic(hosts), Users=todynamic(users), IncidentSources=todynamic(incident_sources), RuleBasedScore=rule_based_score, ManualScore=manual_score, WildfireHits=wildfire_hits, AlertsGroupingStatus=alerts_grouping_status, MitreTacticsIdsAndNames=todynamic(mitre_tactics_ids_and_names), MitreTechniquesIdsAndNames=todynamic(mitre_techniques_ids_and_names), AlertCategories=todynamic(alert_categories), OriginalTags=todynamic(original_tags), Tags=todynamic(tags)

source | project  TimeGenerated = now(), AuditId=AUDIT_ID, AuditOwnerName=AUDIT_OWNER_NAME, AuditOwnerEmail=AUDIT_OWNER_EMAIL, AuditAssetJSON=todynamic(AUDIT_ASSET_JSON), AuditAssetNames=AUDIT_ASSET_NAMES, AuditHostName=AUDIT_HOSTNAME, AuditResult=AUDIT_RESULT, AuditReason=AUDIT_REASON, AuditDescription=AUDIT_DESCRIPTION, AuditEntity=AUDIT_ENTITY, AuditEntitySubtype=AUDIT_ENTITY_SUBTYPE, AuditSessionId=AUDIT_SESSION_ID, AuditCaseId=AUDIT_CASE_ID, AuditInsertTime=datetime(1970-01-01) + (AUDIT_INSERT_TIME * 1ms), AuditSeverity=AUDIT_SEVERITY,AuditSourceIp=AUDIT_SOURCE_IP,AuditUserAgent=AUDIT_USER_AGENT,AuditUserRoles=todynamic(AUDIT_USER_ROLES)

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the record was generated

columns.name: AuditId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the audit event

columns.name: AuditOwnerName
columns.description: Name of the owner who initiated the audit event

columns.name: AuditOwnerEmail
columns.description: Email address of the audit owner

columns.name: AuditAssetJSON
columns.description: JSON object containing the audit asset details

columns.name: AuditAssetNames
columns.description: Names of the assets involved in the audit

columns.name: AuditHostName
columns.description: Host name associated with the audit event

columns.name: AuditResult
columns.description: Result of the audit event (e.g., SUCCESS)

columns.name: AuditReason
columns.description: Reason for the audit event

columns.name: AuditDescription
columns.description: Description of the audit event

columns.name: AuditEntity
columns.description: Entity type associated with the audit event

columns.name: AuditEntitySubtype
columns.description: Subtype of the audit entity (e.g., Login)

columns.name: AuditSessionId
columns.description: Session ID related to the audit event

columns.name: AuditCaseId
columns.description: Case ID related to the audit event

columns.name: AuditInsertTime
columns.description: Time when the audit record was inserted into the system.

columns.name: AuditSeverity
columns.description: The Severity of the Audit log.

columns.name: AuditSourceIp
columns.description: The source Ip of the audit log.

columns.name: AuditUserAgent
columns.description: The User Agent of the audit user.

columns.name: AuditUserRoles
columns.description: The roles of the audit user.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the record was generated

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the event

columns.name: ReceivedTime
columns.description: The time when the event was received

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: Unique identifier of the endpoint

columns.name: EndpointName
columns.description: Name of the endpoint involved in the event

columns.name: Domain
columns.description: Domain associated with the endpoint

columns.name: TrapsVersion
columns.description: Version of the Traps agent installed on the endpoint

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Category of the event

columns.name: AgentType
columns.description: Type of agent involved in the event

columns.name: Subtype
columns.description: Subtype of the event

columns.name: Result
columns.description: Outcome or result of the event

columns.name: Reason
columns.description: Reason for the event or action

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Detailed description of the event

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: ExternalId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the alert in the external system (Cortex XDR).

columns.name: Severity
columns.description: Level of severity of the alert (e.g., Low, Medium, High, Critical).

columns.name: MatchingStatus
columns.description: Status of matching detection logic (e.g., matched or not matched).

columns.name: EndMatchAttempt
columns.description: Timestamp of the last match attempt in Unix epoch format.

columns.name: LocalInsert
columns.description: Local timestamp of when the alert was inserted into the system in Unix epoch format.

columns.name: BiocIndicator
columns.description: Indicator or behavior related to the alert, stored as a dynamic object (behavioral IOC data).

columns.name: MatchingServiceRuleId
columns.description: ID of the matching rule or service used to trigger the alert.

columns.name: AttemptCounter
columns.description: Number of attempts to match this alert with detection rules.

columns.name: Whitelisted
columns.description: Indicates whether the alert has been whitelisted (true/false).

columns.name: Starred
columns.description: Indicates whether the alert has been marked as important or starred (true/false).

columns.name: MitreTechniqueIdAndName
columns.description: MITRE ATT&CK technique ID and name associated with the alert.

columns.name: MitreTacticIdAndName
columns.description: MITRE ATT&CK tactic ID and name associated with the alert.

columns.name: AgentVersion
columns.description: Version of the Cortex XDR agent that generated the alert.

columns.name: AgentFQDN
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the endpoint device where the alert originated.

columns.name: AgentOSType
columns.description: Operating system type of the agent (e.g., Windows, macOS, Linux).

columns.name: AgentDataCollectionStatus
columns.description: Status indicating whether the agent is actively collecting data (true/false).

columns.name: MacAddress
columns.description: MAC address of the endpoint device, represented as a dynamic object.

columns.name: AlertId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the alert in Cortex XDR.

columns.name: DetectionTimestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the detection occurred, in Unix epoch format.

columns.name: Name
columns.description: Name of the detection or alert.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Category or classification of the alert (e.g., malware, suspicious activity).

columns.name: EndpointId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the endpoint where the alert was detected.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Detailed description of the alert or detection.

columns.name: HostIp
columns.description: IP address of the host machine where the alert was generated, represented as a dynamic object.

columns.name: HostName
columns.description: Name of the host machine where the alert was generated.

columns.name: Source
columns.description: Source of the alert or detection data (e.g., Cortex XDR, endpoint agent).

columns.name: Action
columns.description: Action taken in response to the alert (e.g., block, quarantine, notify).

columns.name: ActionPretty
columns.description: Human-readable version of the action taken for the alert.

columns.name: CausalityActorCausalityId
columns.description: Causality ID of the actor involved.

connectorUiConfig.title: Palo Alto Cortex XDR (Preview)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Palo Alto Cortex XDR](https://cortex-panw.stoplight.io/docs/cortex-xdr/branches/main/09agw06t5dpvw-cortex-xdr-rest-api) data connector allows ingesting logs from the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API into Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector is built on Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform. It uses the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API to fetch logs and it supports DCR-based [ingestion time transformations](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-overview) that parses the received security data into a custom table so that queries don't need to parse it again, thus resulting in better performance.

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Incidents_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Incidents_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Endpoints_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
PaloAltoCortexXDR_Endpoints_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_Alerts_CL

PaloAltoCortexXDR_Alerts_CL
       | where TimeGenerated > ago(12h)                | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

            | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

parameters.content:
#### Configuration steps for the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API 
 Follow the instructions to obtain the credentials. you can also follow this [guide](https://cortex-panw.stoplight.io/docs/cortex-xdr/branches/main/3u3j0e7hcx8t1-get-started-with-cortex-xdr-ap-is) to generate API key.

#### 1. Retrieve API URL
   1.1. Log in to the Palo Alto Cortex XDR [**Management Console**] with Admin user credentials
   1.2. In the [**Management Console**], click [**Settings**] -> [**Configurations**] 
   1.3. Under [**Integrations**] click on [**API Keys**].
   1.4. In the [**Settings**] Page click on [**Copy API URL**] in the top right corner.

#### 2. Retrieve API Token
   2.1. Log in to the Palo Alto Cortex XDR [**Management Console**] with Admin user credentials
 2.2. In the [**Management Console**], click [**Settings**] -> [**Configurations**] 
   2.3. Under [**Integrations**] click on [**API Keys**].
   2.4. In the [**Settings**] Page click on [**New Key**] in the top right corner.
   2.5. Choose security level, role, choose Standard and click on [**Generate**]
   2.6. Copy the API Token, once it generated the [**API Token ID**] can be found under the ID column

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Palo Alto Cortex XDR data connector allows ingesting logs from the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API into Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector is built on Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform. It uses the Palo Alto Cortex XDR API to fetch agents, alerts, incidents, management and endpoint logs and it supports DCR-based ingestion time transformations that parses the received security data into a custom table, thus resulting in better performance.

Data Connectors: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
